Shadow
You can use this style element simply by adding a class to the appropriate block,for example: <div class="shadow-wraper"> <div class="da-shadow-1 shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-2 shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-3 shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-4 shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-5 shadow_style"></div> </div> Buttons

Flat Buttons

Raised Buttons

Flat buttons are typically used for less-pronounced actions. In cards, Flat buttonshelp maintain an emphasis on card content. Raised buttons are high-emphasis, distinguished by their use of elevation and fill. They contain actions that are primary to your app. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <h3>Flat Buttons</h3> <div class="button-wraper"> <button class="da-button button-style">Default</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_colored button-style">Colored</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_disabled button-style">Disabled</button> </div> <h3>Raised Buttons</h3> <div class="button-wraper"> <button class="da-button da-raised-button_default button-style">Default</button> <button class="da-button da-raised-button_colored button-style">Colored</button> <button class="da-button da-raised-button_disabled button-style">Disabled</button> </div> Cards Cards are surfaces that display content and actions on a single topic.They should be easy to scan for relevant and actionable information. Elements, like text and images, should be placed on them in a way that clearly indicates hierarchy. Although cards can support multiple actions, UI controls, and an overflow menu, use restraint and remember that cards are entry points to more complex and detailed information.

Cards are a convenient means of displaying content composed of different types of objects.

Card headline title

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores.No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.

Card with image header

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores.No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.

For the creation of the above examples of cards, you can use the classes of thelibrary, which are given in the code below: <div class="da-card card-style"> <div class="da-card__text"> <p>Cards are a convenient means of displaying content composed of different types of objects.</p> </div> <div class="da-card__button"> <button class="da-button card-style__button">Hurray!</button> </div> </div> <div class="da-card card-style"> <div class="da-card__title">Card headline title</div> <div class="da-card__text"> <p> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores.No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.</p> </div> <hr class="da-card__line"> <div class="da-card__button"> <button class="da-button card-style__button">More info...</button> <button class="da-button card-style__button card-style__button_indent">Decline</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_colored card-style__button">Accept</button> </div> </div> <div class="da-card card-style"> <div class="da-card__header card-style__header"><img class="da-card__image" src="images/card_picture.png" alt=""> <div class="da-card__title da-card__image-title card-style__image-title">Card with image header</div> </div> <div class="da-card__text"> <p> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores.No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.</p> </div> <hr class="da-card__line"> <div class="da-card__button"> <button class="da-button card-style__button">More info...</button> <button class="da-button card-style__button card-style__button_indent">Decline</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_colored card-style__button">Accept</button> </div> </div> Checkbox Checkboxes allow the user to select one or more items from a set. Checkboxescan be used to turn an option on or off. If you have multiple options appearing in a list, you can preserve space by using checkboxes instead of on/off switches. If you have a single option, avoid using a checkbox and use an on/off switch instead.
Notify me about updates to apps or games that I’ve downloaded Auto-update apps over wifi only Remove all the searches you have ever performed
You can see the example code below: <div class="checkbox-style__block"> <input class="da-checkbox" id="notific" type="checkbox" name="notifications"> <label class="da-checkbox-label" for="notific"><span class="da-checkbox__logo"> <svg width="12px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 12 10"> <polyline points="1.5 6 4.5 9 10.5 1"></polyline> </svg></span><span class="da-checkbox__title">Notifications</span></label><span class="da-checkbox-desc checkbox-style__indent">Notify me about updates to apps or games that I’ve downloaded</span> <input class="da-checkbox" id="updat" type="checkbox" name="update"> <label class="da-checkbox-label" for="updat"><span class="da-checkbox__logo"> <svg width="12px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 12 10"> <polyline points="1.5 6 4.5 9 10.5 1"></polyline> </svg></span><span class="da-checkbox__title">Auto-updates</span></label><span class="da-checkbox-desc checkbox-style__indent">Auto-update apps over wifi only</span> <input class="da-checkbox" id="clear" type="checkbox" name="clear"> <label class="da-checkbox-label" for="clear"><span class="da-checkbox__logo"> <svg width="12px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 12 10"> <polyline points="1.5 6 4.5 9 10.5 1"></polyline> </svg></span><span class="da-checkbox__title">Clear search history</span></label><span class="da-checkbox-desc">Remove all the searches you have ever performed</span> </div> Radio Button Radio buttons allow the user to select one option from a set. Use radio buttonswhen the user needs to see all available options. If available options can be collapsed, consider using a dropdown menu because it uses less space. Radio buttons should have the most commonly used option selected by default.
Keep Wi-Fi on during sleep
The code for the buttons above looks like this: <div class="radio-style__block"><span class="da-radio-desc">Keep Wi-Fi on during sleep</span> <input class="da-radio" id="always" type="radio" name="keep"> <label class="da-radio-label" for="always"><span class="da-radio__body"><span class="da-radio__body-center"></span></span><span class="da-radio__title">Always</span></label> <input class="da-radio" id="plug" type="radio" name="keep"> <label class="da-radio-label" for="plug"><span class="da-radio__body"><span class="da-radio__body-center"></span></span><span class="da-radio__title">Only when plugged in</span></label> <input class="da-radio" id="never" type="radio" name="keep"> <label class="da-radio-label" for="never"><span class="da-radio__body"><span class="da-radio__body-center"></span></span><span class="da-radio__title">Never</span></label> </div> Switch(Toggle) Switches toggle the state of a single setting on or off. They are the preferredway to adjust settings on mobile. The option that the switch controls, as well as the state it’s in, should be made clear from the corresponding inline label.
Example of using elements: <div class="switch-style__block"> <input class="da-switch" id="wifi" type="checkbox"> <label class="da-switch-label" for="wifi"><span class="da-switch__slider da-switch__round"></span>Wi-Fi</label> <input class="da-switch" id="bluetoothe" type="checkbox"> <label class="da-switch-label" for="bluetoothe"><span class="da-switch__slider da-switch__round"></span>Bluetooth</label> <input class="da-switch" id="airplane" type="checkbox"> <label class="da-switch-label" for="airplane"><span class="da-switch__slider da-switch__round"></span>Airplane Mode</label> </div> Progress Circular Progress indicators inform users about the status of ongoing processes, such asloading an app, submitting a form, or saving updates. They communicate an app’s state and indicate available actions, such as whether users can navigate away from the current screen.
Circular progress support both determinate and indeterminate processes. <div class="progress-circular-style__block"> <div class="progress-circular-1"></div> <div class="progress-circular-2"></div> <div class="progress-circular-3"></div> <div class="progress-circular-4"></div> <div class="progress-circular-5"></div> </div> Progress Linear Linear progress indicators display progress by animating an indicator along thelength of a fixed, visible track. The behavior of the indicator is dependent on whether the progress of a process is known.
Determinate operations display the indicator increasing in width from 0 to 100% ofthe track, in sync with the process’s progress. An example is shown below: <div class="progress-linear-style__block"> <div class="progress-linear-1"></div> <div class="progress-linear-2"></div> <div class="progress-linear-3"></div> <div class="progress-linear-4"></div> <div class="progress-linear-5"></div> <div class="progress-linear-6"></div> </div> Tabs Tabs organize and allow navigation between groups of content that are related andat the same level of hierarchy.

class="da-tabs-toolbar__image-container"><img src="images/search.png" alt="" width="18px" height="18px"> <div class="rippleJS"></div> </div> </div> </div> Toolbar In computer interface design, a toolbar is a graphical control element onwhich on-screen buttons, icons, menus, or other input or output elements are placed. Toolbars are seen in many types of software such as office suites, graphics editors and web browsers.
Toolbar
Toolbar: toll
Toolbar: tall with elements aligned to the bottom
Toolbar: medium-tall with labels aligned to the bottom
Toolbar: tall with labels aligned to the middleToolbar elements aligned to the bottom
Toolbar can transform into a contextual action bar or used as a navbar. <div class="toolbar-style__block"> <div class="da-toolbar-default toolbar-style__default-color"> <div alt="" width="18px" height="18px"> <div class="rippleJS"></div> </div> </div> </div> Data Tables Data tables display information in a way that’s easy to scan, so that users canlook for patterns and insights. They can be embedded in primary content, such as cards. Data tables can include: a corresponding visualization; navigation; tools to query and manipulate data. When including tools, they should be placed directly above or below the table.
Card Heading
item selected
1-10 of 100
A data table contains a header row at the top that lists column names, followedby rows for data. Checkboxes should accompany each row if the user needs to select or manipulate data. <div class="data-tables-style__block"> <div id="da-table"> <div class="da-table__main-title"><span>Card
